data.text: This is the burden that Habakkuk the prophet received in a vision:
How long, O LORD, must I call for help
Why do You make me see iniquity?
For behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans 1:6 That is, the Babylonians—
Their horses are swifter than leopards,
All of them come bent on violence;
Then they sweep by like the wind
Your eyes are too pure to look upon evil,
You have made men like the fish of the sea,
The foe pulls all of them up 1:15 Literally He pulls all of them up with a hook;
Therefore he sacrifices to his dragnet
Will he, therefore, empty his net
